title: Hollyoaks spoilers: Sarah Jayne Dunn reveals Mandy, Darren and Nancy heartache
text:
(Picture: Lime Pictures)

You know what it’s like when you’re buried in underground caves with your ex and you can’t resist another smooch for old time’s sake. That’s the position Hollyoaks stalwarts Darren and Nancy Osborne (Ashley Taylor Dawson and Jessica Fox) found themselves in before they managed to get out alive.

And it’s sure to have huge consequences for Mandy Richardson, who may not be able to come back from this fresh level of betrayal in the ever messy love web of the Hollyoaks Originals. We caught up with Sarah Jayne Dunn, who plays her, to get the lowdown on what comes next.

She explained to Metro.co.uk: ‘Now, Darren and Mandy know baby DJ is Luke’s so we play out the aftermath of that – can they move forward from this; can Darren carry on with DJ knowing that he is Luke’s? It’s a huge emotional rollercoaster for them all. And Ollie is in the mix too – the fact he kept that big secret is massive and so much has been stirred up from this. There is also the jeopardy of Mandy almost losing Darren in the tunnels so with that on top of the emotion, there is a lot to be processed.

‘She wants to be with Darren – she has made it clear that’s where her heart is. Even when they weren’t sure if the baby was Darren or Luke’s, she was quite adamant that she wanted them to be a family. When he disappeared, she was terrified she lost him. And then, he reappears and she has not a clue about what has gone on down there! Naughty Darren! She just wants them to be happy and to repair everything but there’s so much more to it now. So it’s huge.

(Picture: Lime Pictures)

‘I think she is always going to have insecurities with Nancy. They were best friends and Mandy betrayed her by getting with her husband and that relationship was ruined. But because they have such a strong history together and have children together, there will always be this insecurity. If she found out what had happened, it would be tough to come back from. It would be tough to trust them again – Darren did this in the first place with Nancy and has now cheated on Mandy with Nancy again! It’s a whole can of worms – it’s going to be huge when it comes out!’

Of course, fans have come to expect nothing but chaos between this selection of characters and Sarah heaps praise on the many available storylines that writers can get out of these characters with so much history together.

She enthused: ‘I really like how the characters are so intertwined – I mean it’s so incestuous! Mandy and Luke, Mandy and Darren, Darren and Nancy – and now Luke and Cindy! And Mandy and Tony too! I just love it. It does make for really fun storytelling – it’s not one dimensional, there are so many elements to all of these revelations. I hope it’s fun for the viewers to watch how it impacts all these characters.’

But where does Mandy’s heart really lie? Will she always class Luke Morgan (Gary Lucy) as her true soulmate or is Darren the one for her? or could there even be a piece of her that still pines for Tony Hutchinson (Nick Pickard)?

Sarah responded: ‘Oh goodness, I don’t know! I love the relationship with Mandy and Darren. I love that they have gone there – they have this history and were kind of childhood sweethearts. It’s really worked so far – before all of this, they were in a really good place. Their bubble is bursting and everything is crumbling but if DJ had been Darren’s and none of this happened, they could have had their happy ending but that’s not how soaps go is it?

‘I think she will always have feelings for Luke – whether they could ever be a couple again, I don’t know. They are not good for each other; would they ever go there again? As for Tony – they always will have a lot of love for each other but I don’t think they’d ever go there again. Besides, Tony and Diane are such a good couple – I champion them all the way!’

With another stunt week done and dusted, it’s onto the aftermath and certain drama for Mandy, Luke and Darren. But Sarah has loved being involved in the high octane scenes and marvels that the show can still find unique ways to bring about October carnage.

She grinned: ‘It was great – it took a few weeks to film, I haven’t done one for a few years. I got to do a bit of stunt woman action so that was fun. It was something different, wasn’t it? I don’t know how they keep coming up with ideas for it every year, it’s mad. I thought it was great, I loved it. It’s nice to have so many of us involved; there are so many storylines intertwined.’

And with Hollyoaks going from strength to strength, winning awards and critical acclaim left, right and centre, Sarah couldn’t be prouder of the show. And she is overjoyed to be with the cast and crew as preparations for the 25th anniversary next year get underway.

She shared: ‘It’s such a testament to everyone who works on it. We have so many older and new cast who are all great – the show always has fresh talent at the forefront while always having that core unit of cast and crew who have been there from day one and share that passion. If you’d told me when I started 23 years ago that I’d be here for the 25th anniversary I wouldn’t have believed you. Not because I didn’t have faith for the show but for me personally, I never thought I’d have the privilege of being part of something so special for so long.

‘It’s come on leaps and bounds and I do think we are at the strongest it’s ever been. I love that the show explores such strong storylines that other shows aren’t brave enough to do – I do feel we always go there first and that’s a testament to Bryan and everyone involved. It’s incredible and I can’t wait to celebrate it next year. 25 years – that’s mad!’
